ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Anjana Print & Binding : This press continues to remain closed due to advancement of technology and the market shifting from printing in type-set press to offset presses. However we have doing some nominal binding work for children during the beginning of the academic year. Kamala Nehru Type Writing Institute : As in previous years we have been training girls in type writing. This is being done with our own funds. Thirumagal Tailoring Institute : As always this has been quite popular with the ladies in nearby areas for undergoing training in tailoring. Sahodari Family Counseling Centre : This is being run with Central Government giving 80% as grant and the balance being put in by the Sangam. The importance of this centre has been growing due to valuable service being rendered in solving various problems faced by women especially in marital issues. This year this centre at our Sangam handled 121 cases. This Sangam took pleasure & pride in conducting the International Womens Day and National Day for Girl Child programmes on 6th March 2009. The Government of India, State Government of Tamilnadu & various philanthropists have made immense contribution to the functioning of this Sangam. We thank them all. The Sangam has been offering its services to women of various castes & religions without any bar & bias. In doing so, we believe we have been serving the cause of integration of the society. The renovated building (own) was opened by the Mrs.Saraswati wife of then President Mr.V.V.Giri

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Shri AMM Murugappa chettiar Research Centre popularly known as MCRC is a non profit research orgabnisation haveing its ideologies entered at developing technololgies their dissemination relevant for rural appliation to bettr the lving standard of people beloonging to the rural section of the soceity. Several technologies on the thrust areas like energy, wasteland develpmemnt , resource sonservation, biofuels, biotechnology, health, nutrition, biogas, solar, paper from alternate materials, anaerobic digestion system, natural dyes and organic farming are developed and disseminated for societial uplift. The centre has implemented many project with financial assistances from DBT, DST, MNES & CAPART. MCRC has won many awards and laurels .

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The SWEED Trust has established in 2012 with the objective of giving access to quality education to underprivileged children in rural areas of Gingee Taluk, Viluppuram District. SWEED NGO educational programme is a multy-year intensive effort to improve learning levels of children in the poorest and most marginalised villages in Viluppuram District, Gingee Taluk. In each village 2 local tutors are hired and trained to provide 2-hours of after school evening lsupport classes for children.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: One Hundred and Seventy Women SHGs Formed Five hundred farmers training on Organic farming and practicing Five hundred poor children have received educational materials Four Hundred poor women and men farmers trained on vermin compost compost making and mush room cultivation One hundred and seventy five PLWHAs counseling service regularly Fifty women benefited IGP loan for goat and dairy rearing Two hundred tribal women received bed sheets One thousand five hundred girls attended RCH

sourceOfFunds.purpose: The purpose of the project is to enable 90 small and marginal farming women learn the Techniques of Production Vermi Compost, Compost and Mushroom Cultivation. The production of Vermin Compost, Compost and mushroom cultivation would be sold and in the market after making use of compost and vermin compost for their own agricultural purposes.

The purpose of the project is to Capacity building training, Awareness camps, Traditional cultural events, IEC materials  Hand outs, Pamphlets, Cycle rally and issuing of cloth bags to community would be major programs / activities. We would conduct program in villages / public gathering places  temples, weekly markets, Bus stands etc.
We have conducted National Environment Awareness Campaign and Rally, Tree planting, competition in schools and giving handbills etc. to the participants.

We have provided school books, Note Books, Uniform dresses, shoes, medicines for the elder people, Income generation programme for tribal women SHGs, Marriage assistance, woolen cloths for elder persons etc.

The purpose of the project was to train 90 rural poor women towards income generation through Vermin Compost, Compost Making and Mush room cultivation per year. Thus in a period of 2 years 180 rural poor women were trained and supplied with raw material to engage in Vermin compost, Compost production and Mushroom cultivation in Thogaimalai Block of Karur District, TamilNadu, India.

The purpose of the project is provided protected drinking water through drilling bore well and installation hand pump with cloth washing stone at Kampathamparai scheduled caste village.The people are taking drinking water at any time without burden.

The purpose of the project is Promote Academic Skills of Dalit Children Through Special Intensive Coaching. Dalit children are members of the lowest rank of the Indian society which often face discrimination and have very low academic performance. the children began to overcome their hesitation and started to enjoy their classes. Teachers are trying to show these youngsters (both girls and boys between 11 and 17 years of age) the value of education and the importance of knowing their rights.

The purpose of the project is to Promote Academic Skills of Dalit Children Through Special Intensive Coaching. Dalit children are members of the lowest rank of the Indian society which often face discrimination and have very low academic performance. the children began to overcome their hesitation and started to enjoy their classes. Teachers are trying to show these youngsters (both girls and boys between 11 and 17 years of age) the value of education and the importance of knowing their rights.

The purpose of the project is to Promote Awareness Creation on avoid plastics and Wastes management and waste water management through capacity building training, Awareness rally, hand bills, pamphlets, Traditional cultural programmes, tree plantation , formation on vermin compost unit etc. 100 beneficiaries were participated in this programs. Each training were 2 days conducted with eminent resource persons. The participants have taken oaths for not using plastic materials.

Value addition techniques training was conducted for 15 days on pickle making from Gooseberry, Lemon, Tomato, Mango, preparation of Chilli powder, Sambar powder, Curry powders, Garlic pickle, Citron pickle, Potato chips, Root chips, Tomato ketchup, Raw rice dried cakes. These skills enabled women to earn money with limited investments. Moreover, these value added products are cost less than compared with fresh vegetables. Women could keep the tried food items 4 to 5 days.

ngoList.title: Society for Education and Development
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: A BRIEF REPORT OF THE ACTIVITIES OF SOCIETY FOR EDUCATION AND DEVELOPMENT The Society for Education and Development is non-profit organization established to extend a helping hand to the underprivileged sections of the society particularly rural Villages,urban slums and tribal areas. Vision: SED envisages for itself a role of a Resource centre for integrated education of Adults/youth and children, bringing the concerns of health, life skills and livelihood. Mission: Provide Contextually relevant support to community based initiatives for quality of life through education/training and advocacy. Objectives : 1. To serve the community irrespective of caste, creed, religion in the context of their family coming for their education and Development 2. To develop alternative models/ strategies for implementation of education and development programmes 3. To organize the training to the functionaries of various levels involved in the education and development programmes 4. To prepare teaching/ training materials needed for the projects of education and development programmes 5. To coordinate the agencies concerned in education and development projects at the field level. 6. To undertake such activities and programmes are consonant with the above objectives of the society Area of operation The office is functioning at Chennai having field office at vandavasi block, Thiruvannmalai District. The major programmes and activities organized at vandavasi block, Thiruvannamali District.However, the programmes/Activities also organized in the districts of Kanceepuram,thiruvallur and Vellore. Field Programmes and Activities: Self Help groups At present 120 Self help groups are functioning with the support of Society. Apart from the savings, availing of the loan, repayment SHG members are engaged in vocational training by individual and groups through that they are earning an average of Rs- 4000 to 5000 per month individually. Adolescents Groups There are 40 Adolescent groups functioning actively at present. Each group consists of 20  25 members. There are 30 groups for girls and 10 groups for boys. Periodical training such as Leadership, communication and Life skills organized for these groups. These groups are involved in organizing awareness programmes, besides their routine activities of the groups. Supplementary Education Centers There are five supplementary education Centers functioning from the year 2002.These centers functioning in the evenings 6.00 pm to 8.00 pm. These centre are functioning as Tution centers for school going children and non-formal education center for out of school children. These centers are managed by the volunteer teachers appointed on honorarium basis. On an average 150 to 200 children in the age group of 6-14 are benefited through this programme. Training/ Awareness programmes From the beginning, this agency involved in organizing the training programmes for School teachers, Non-formal Education instructors SHG groups based on the demand at the field level. Besides the staff SED are participating as Resource persons in the training Programmes organized by other institutions/agencies. In addition to the above Awareness Meetings/ Trainings are also organized on Health, Legal, RTE. RTI etc periodically at frequent intervals. Besides, important days like Republic day, Independence Day Children day etc. In each programme 200-300 participants attends this type of programmes. Crche for Children Crche for Children in the age group of 3-5 years run by the Society since 2005.Through this Crche every year 25-30 Children are benefited. This Crche is managed by One teacher assisted by one assistant cum cook. This scheme is fully funded by TamilNadu Social welfare Board Govt. of TamilNadu

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Society for Engineering Education Enrichment (SEEE) is the nonprofit organization for the engineering profession in India. SEEE founded in 2016, major challenge by a group of young graduate engineers in India to serve the interests of the individual engineer in India across all the disciplines of engineering. SEEEs key areas of focus are Promoting and protecting the Professional engineer, Leadership, Developing future Professional Engineers. SEEE shall be one of the very best Engineering Professional bodies in the world. It is dedicated to providing quality service aimed at enhancing professional competence and development of its members at all times. The society looks after the professional needs of members through well structured programmes and regular interactions among the different cadre of membership, enhancing high professional standard and ethical practices. SEEE is committed to focus collaboration with, influencing and providing quality advice to the various arms for the purpose of uplifting the country as a whole. SEEE shall make meaningful contributions to the advancement of technology worldwide. Our mission is to inspire, inform and influence the global engineering community, supporting technology innovation to meet the needs of society. We treat everyone with integrity and respect, continually striving for excellence in all our activities and use the power of teamwork to deliver value.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: SPEECH, has been involved in designing the project in consultation with communities with whom they work. SPEECH has been working in the area since 1987 and has built strong relationships with the communities in the proposed field and area of operations, and also with the proposed partners in the operation. SPEECH will be the main implementing body working with other stakeholders. SPEECH will be working in partnership with government departments such as the Agricultural Engineering Department who will be responsible for carrying out structural work giving technical support and advice, such as water tank maintenance. The local agricultural research station will be able to feed information into the project. This SPEECH-government partnership will benefit both parties as the agriculture department has information on government schemes such as subsidies to farmers but lacks strengths in mobilising people, which SPEECH does have. They will learn from SPEECHs local involvement, which will contribute to one of the minor objectives of the project: capacity building of partners. Partnerships with banks through womens self help groups will be built on in maintaining links between local people and the banks. This will build the capacity of banks in gaining experience of working with local community groups.  After 1992, SPEECH researched at each intervention through which SPEECH looked at its strength and weaknesses. It also did several studies One on Perception of Eye care services at Tiruchuli, another on Sustainable Agriculture and life of people. It also did look at the Coral Reef of Mannar Bay as an International Research. IIED has been a partner to SPEECH in many of these Researches particularly on PRA studies. SPEECH has been therefore recognized now as an Agency connected with International Development Scenario.  While SPEECH assisted Dalits with Land Development, they at the same time assisted Non Dalits with other helps such as goat or sheep rearing. Thus they matched development at the different communities in the villages. The renovation of common tanks helped all Communities in the Villages and brought every one accept SPEECH intervention.  By 1995, the Concept of Self Help Group came into focus as part of Women Development. This made the local sanghams which consisted of men and women slowly faded away to give space for emerging Women Self Help Groups and Women Capacitating Programmes. The emerged Self Help Groups focused mainly on Savings and Credit. SPEECH and Community Women together named them as Nanayam Groups. Nanayam in Tamil has two meanings, one Coin and the other Dignity. As a starting point of its commitment to the deprived Children, SPEECH entered the National Child Labor Project (NCLP)  Special School for Working Children at Duraisamypuram in 1989  The effective Child Rights approach has widened into the villages with starting up of Children Resource Centers. While these Resource centers are primarily tuition centers, more concentration is given in the developing of talents of these children. With spaces for buildings generally contributed by Community, SPEECH has built up several Children Resources Centers in the form of an accessible building to all Children of the Communities.  Play things have been installed to ensure that all Children irrespective of their age come and enjoy the swings and the ladder. Little Children joyfully oscillate in the swings has turned a regular feature in the villages.  SPEECH has intervened to the Asian Disaster - Tsunami affected places in and around Nagappattinam in Tamilnadu effectively. Since 26th of December 2004, it has done its interventions with much participation from the Neglected Communities and Government of Tamilnadu.  As part of the Tsunami Coordination Committee from the Government of Tamilnadu as well part of the Forum of NGOs working at Tsunami areas, its intervention is one of the models much gets appreciation from the locals as well abroad.
